sentence.Network_en: A modern chronicler of hell might look to the lives of chronic - pain patients for inspiration.
sentence.Network_cn: 一位现代地狱记实者可以从观察慢性疼痛病患者的生活中寻找灵感.

sentence.Network_en: The chronicler sets down every detail, believing all to be of ultimate significance.
sentence.Network_cn: 编年史家把每一件琐事都记了下来, 相信最终都是珍贵史料.

sentence.Network_en: In Touch apparently has become the Official Chronicler of American Bedding.
sentence.Network_cn: 《每周接触》似乎已成为美国床上用品的编年史.

entry.tran: 按时间顺序记述(或播放)
entry.def: To chronicle a series of events means to write about them or show them in broadcasts in the order in which they happened.

example.ex: The series chronicles the everyday adventures of two eternal bachelors.
example.tran: 这个系列剧按照时间顺序记述了两个老光棍每天的奇遇。

entry.def: A chronicle is an account or record of a series of events.

example.tran: 这套大部头的拿破仑时代编年史

entry.def: Chronicle is sometimes used as part of the name of a newspaper.
